lead_paragraph: Top-ranked Roger Federer has lost consecutive matches for the first time in four and a half years, falling yesterday to Fernando González, 4-6, 7-6 (1), 7-5, at the season-ending Masters Cup in Shanghai.The loss ended Federer’s 15-match winning streak in round-robin play at this tournament, which features the top eight men’s singles players and doubles teams. Earlier yesterday, Andy Roddick overcame a lapse in the second set to defeat Nikolay Davydenko, 6-3, 4-6, 6-2. Federer will probably have to beat Roddick and Davydenko to reach the semifinals.Federer, who won three Grand Slam titles this year, has already clinched the No. 1 ranking for the fourth straight year. But in the last month, he lost twice to David Nalbandian. Each defeat came in a Masters Series event, first in the final at Madrid, then in the third round at Paris.
